XenotypeDef.label: thrall
XenotypeDef.description:
Thralls are rare xenohumans with a set of genes that does not fall into any known xenotype. Thralls are created from fresh corpses and usually cannot exist without the support of a master, since their genetic instabilization inevitably leads to death.
The genetic make-up of thralls varies from thrall to thrall and is highly dependent on the thrall's master. Despite the existence of the so-called "thrall master", thralls are not weak-willed servants. They can make decisions on their own and even leave the master.
<color=#f5ffa2>Gameplay Effect (Genes):</color> All pawns with this xenotype must regularly cellsfeed on resurgent pawns or they will die.
<color=#f5ffa2>Gameplay Effect (Spawn):</color> Pawns generated with this xenotype will receive one of the random sets of genes from existing thralls in the game.
XenotypeDef.descriptionShort: Thralls are rare xenohumans with a set of genes that does not fall into any known xenotype. Thralls are created from fresh corpses and usually cannot exist without the support of a master, since their genetic instabilization inevitably leads to death or transformation into a ghoul.
